This feature will allow users to disable/enable Spread Spectrum Clock for eDP.
Select the number of Pixels to be overlapped per half of Scanline while using Edp Multi-SST(MSO) feature.

This feature enables or disables T3 optimization.
When enabled, VBIOS/GOP driver will poll for AUX soon after VDD enable until AUX passes or T3 time is reached
When disabled, VBIOS/GOP driver will wait for T3 time before trying the first AUX transaction

Using this field the delay from LCDVCC to HPD high can be specified in 100uS.
Valid Range: 0 to 200msec

PageID.WidgetName: Valid video data to Backlight Enable delay (T8):
PageID.HelpText:
Using this field the delay from Start of Valid video data from Source to Backlight Enable can be specified in 100uS.
T8 is inclusive of T7.
Valid Range of T7: 0 to 50msec

Using this field the delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable can be specified in 100uS.
Delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable is included in delay from Valid video data to Backlight Enable (T8).
So it is expected that delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable is less than the delay from Valid video data to Backlight Enable (T8).

Using this field delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off can be specified in 100uS.
Delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off is included in delay from Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data (T9).
So it is expected that delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off delay is less than the delay from Backlight Disable to to End of Valid video data (T9).

PageID.WidgetName: Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data delay (T9):
PageID.HelpText: Using this field the delay from Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data can be specified in 100uS.

PageID.WidgetName: End of Valid video data to Power-Off delay (T10):
PageID.HelpText:
Using this field delay from End of Valid video data from Source to Power-Off can be specified in 100uS.
Valid Range: 0 to 500 msec
Using this field Power-off time can be specified in 100uS.

Block.PageName: eDP Fast Link Training Configuration Parameters

PageID.HelpText: This feature allows for the selection of the Fast Link Training feature is to be enabled or disabled.

This field specifies Data Rate to be used for Fast Link Training in unit of 200KHz for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.

In case of EDP Fast Link Training Params(FLT), if user enters FLT Link Rate value greater than the "eDP Max Port Link Rate"  then driver would use 
   Fast Link training Link Rate = MIN (FLT Link Rate ,  eDP Max Port Link Rate).
This feature allows for the selection of the Lane Count (Port Width) for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
This feature allows for the selection of the Pre-emphasis value for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
This feature allows for the selection of the Voltage Swing value for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
When panel is in PSR mode and 'Full Link Enable' is set to Yes, Link is kept in standby state.
When panel is exiting PSR mode and 'Require AUX to wake up' is set to Yes, the AUX channel handshake(link training is required) will be used.

PageID.WidgetName: Lines to wait before link standby:
PageID.HelpText:
This field determines Lines to wait before link standby
0 lines to wait (Default)
1 lines to wait
4 lines to wait
8 lines to wait
Others Reserved

Idle frames to wait for PSR enable.
Allowed values 0-15. Default value is 0.
This field selects the link training TP1(Training Pattern1) time during PSR exit(wake up)

PageID.WidgetName: Channel Equalization Time for PSR1 panel:
PageID.HelpText: This field selects the link training TP2(Training Pattern2) or TP3(Training Pattern3) or TP4(Training Pattern4) time during PSR1 exit(wake up)

PageID.WidgetName: Channel Equalization Time for PSR2 panel:
PageID.HelpText: This field selects the link training TP2(Training Pattern2) or TP3(Training Pattern3) or TP4(Training Pattern4) time during PSR2 exit(wake up)
This field enables/disables the Apical Assertive Display IP for this panel.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific Panel OUI field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD base address field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD Irdidix control 0 field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD option select field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific backlight value.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific Ambient light value.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific backlight scale field.

PageID.WidgetName: IntelÂ® Display Power Saving Technology (DPST) (Mobile only):
PageID.HelpText:
This feature determines whether the IntelÂ® Display Power Savings Technology (DPST) is enabled or disabled.
IntelÂ® DPST is a display power savings technology that changes the intensity of colors in order to conserve backlight power.
Note: This technology is only active when the system is running in battery mode and the LFP is the only active display device.
This feature determines whether Panel Self Refresh (PSR) feature is to be enabled.

PageID.HelpText:
This field defines the number of RC buffers as per VESA DSC spec.
The number of RC buffers used by the software shall be (Value + 1) where Value is in range 0 to 127.

PageID.WidgetName: Slices per line supported by the sink device:
PageID.HelpText:
This field defines the slices per line supported by the sink device.
The field is defined in bitmap fashion and details of each bits are as defined below:
	Bits 31-10		 Bit 9	Bit 8	Bit 7	Bit 6	Bit 5	Bit 4	 Bit 3	 Bit 2	 Bit 1	 Bit 0
	Reserved		 24	 20	 16	 12	 10	 8	 6	 4	 2	 1
Bit = 0, not supported. Bit = 1, supported
Note: Assumption is that sink shall support all lower slices per line than maximum selected field. i.e. If it supports say 8 slices per line, it will also support 4/2/1 slices per line

PageID.WidgetName: Line buffer depth as per VESA DSC Spec:
PageID.HelpText: Line buffer depth in bits as per VESA DSC spec.

PageID.WidgetName: Input compression BPC supported by the sink device:
PageID.HelpText:
This field defines the compression input bpc supported by the sink device.
The field is defined in bitmap fashion and details of each bits are as defined below:
	Bits 7-4	  Bit 3	  Bit 2	  Bit 1	  Bit 0
	Rsvd	   12 bpc	 10bpc	  8bpc	   Rsvd
Bit = 0, not supported. Bit = 1, supported
Note: Assumption is that sink shall support all lower bpc values than the maximum selected field. i.e. If it supports say 12bpc, it will also support 10 and 8bpc as well

As of today, we are supporting 6/8/10/12 BPP for compression output.
Select the most appropriate BPP as supported by the sink.

PageID.WidgetName: Slice height supported by the sink device:
PageID.HelpText:
Slice height supported by the sink device for DSC slice.
Note: Slice height must divide the picture height uniformly.
This feature helps in selecting Video/Command Mode.

Burst mode

This value is valid only if packet sequence for video mode is Burst Mode.

MIPI Dual Link Front-Back video mode.

In continuous clock mode (Clock Stop Feature disabled), Clock lane will always be in HS mode.
If this feature is enabled, Clock lane also goes to LP state once per frame during the mandated data lane LPM
in MIPI DSI DPI (video) mode

PageID.WidgetName: MIPI DSI Panel Power On/Off Sequence(delays)

PageID.HelpText: Delay to be given after panel power up in 100uS

PageID.WidgetName: Data Turn-On To Panel Backlight Enable Delay:
PageID.HelpText: Delay to be given after MIPI DATA TURN ON and before backlight enabling in 100uS

Delay to be given after PWM-On and before Backlight Enable in 100uS
Delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable is included in delay from Data Turn-On to Panel Backlight Enable.
So it is expected that delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable is less than the delay from Data Turn-On to Panel Backlight Enable.

Delay to be given after Backlight Disable and before Pwm-Off in 100uS
Delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off is included in delay from Backlight Disable to Data Turn-Off.
So it is expected that delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off delay is less than the delay from Backlight Disable to Data Turn-Off.

PageID.WidgetName: Backlight Disable To Data Turn-Off Delay:
PageID.HelpText: Delay to be given after Backlight Disable and before MIPI DATA TURN OFF in 100uS
Delay to be given before panel power down in 100uS
Delay to be given before panel power up and after panel power down in 100uS
This feature defines the LFP panel name, used by driver only. Panel name can be only of 13 characters maximum and rest of the characters will be truncated.
This value specifies the Target X-Resolution for this panel.
This value specifies the Target Y-Resolution for this panel.

Using this field the minimum Refresh Rate to be used for Seamless DRRS feature can be entered in Hertz.
Note: Graphics driver will use this field only when EDID support is disabled in VBT configuration.
This feature allows OEM to select the Backlight Technology.
This feature specifies the Panel Rotation of LFP panel used.
This feature specifies the Panel Position of LFP panel used.

This feature  will allow users to disable/enable Dual LFP Port Sync and it is applicable for DDI-A, DDI-B in case of eDP and DSI-0, DSI-1 in case of MIPI.

PageID.WidgetName: eDP Fast Link Training Configuration Parameters
Edp Max Port Link Rate (in 200 Khz):
PageID.Visibility: Block:2, Field:LFP_Device_Class, Value:6150 or Block:2, Field:LFP2_Device_Class, Value:6150
PageID.HelpText:
This field specifies EDP Max Port Link Rate supported by the port in unit of 200KHz.
Default value would be "0", in which case Display Drivers should consider EDP Max Port Link Rate to be the Platform supported Max Link Rate.
Only when OEM's need to limit to particular Link Rate can enter the value as mentioned in below table.

Note:
1) OEM's need to enter the values mentioned from below table only.
2) If value entered is not matching with any of the below values then Platform supported Max Link Rate should be considere as EDP Max Port Link Rate by the display drivers.
3) In case of EDP Fast Link Training Params(FLT), if user enters FLT Link Rate value greater than the "eDP Max Port Link Rate"  then we need to use 
   Fast Link training Link Rate = MIN (FLT Link Rate ,  eDP Max Port Link Rate)
---------------------------------------------------------
|	Link Rate(Gbps)	|	 Value to enter in text field	|
|	 		|	 in terms of 200KHZ    	|
---------------------------------------------------------
|	 1.62 		|	        8100           	|
|	 2.16 		|	        10800          	|
|	 2.43 		|	        12150          	|
|	 2.7  		|	        13500          	|
|	 3.24 		|	        16200          	|
|	 3.78 		|	        18900          	|
|	 4.32 		|	        21600          	|
|	 5.4  		|	        27000          	|
|	 6.48 		|	        32400          	|
|	 6.75 		|	        33750          	|
|	 8.1  		|	        40500          	|
This feature specifies the color depth of eDP panel used.

(mV) 		 Level-2/300mV 		 300mV, 0.0db 		 300mV, 1.3db 		 N/A 		  N/A
		 Level-3/350mV 		 350mV, 0.0db 		 N/A 		  N/A 		  N/A

		 DP Applet 		 Level-0/0dB 		 Level-1/1.5dB 		 Level-2/4dB 		 Level-3/6dB
Voltage 		 Level-0/350mV 		 350mV, 0.0db 		 350mV, 3.1db 		 350mV, 6.0db 		 350mV, 8.2db

(mV) 		 Level-2/650mV 		 650mV, 0.6db 		 600mV, 3.5db 		 N/A 		  N/A
		 Level-3/900mV 		 900mV, 0.0db 		 N/A 		  N/A 		  N/A

		 Level-3/900mV 		 900mV, 0.0db 		 N/A 		  N/A 		  N/A


For HBR2:
						 Pre-Emphasis (db)
		 DP Applet 		 Level-0/0dB 		 Level-1/1.5dB 		 Level-2/4dB 		 Level-3/6dB

This feature will allow users to disable/enable Spread Spectrum Clock for eDP.
Select the number of Pixels to be overlapped per half of Scanline while using Edp Multi-SST(MSO) feature.

This feature enables or disables T3 optimization.
When enabled, VBIOS/GOP driver will poll for AUX soon after VDD enable until AUX passes or T3 time is reached
When disabled, VBIOS/GOP driver will wait for T3 time before trying the first AUX transaction

Using this field the delay from LCDVCC to HPD high can be specified in 100uS.
Valid Range: 0 to 200msec

PageID.WidgetName: Valid video data to Backlight Enable delay (T8):
PageID.HelpText:
Using this field the delay from Start of Valid video data from Source to Backlight Enable can be specified in 100uS.
T8 is inclusive of T7.
Valid Range of T7: 0 to 50msec

Using this field the delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable can be specified in 100uS.
Delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable is included in delay from Valid video data to Backlight Enable (T8).
So it is expected that delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable is less than the delay from Valid video data to Backlight Enable (T8).

Using this field delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off can be specified in 100uS.
Delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off is included in delay from Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data (T9).
So it is expected that delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off delay is less than the delay from Backlight Disable to to End of Valid video data (T9).

PageID.WidgetName: Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data delay (T9):
PageID.HelpText: Using this field the delay from Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data can be specified in 100uS.

PageID.WidgetName: End of Valid video data to Power-Off delay (T10):
PageID.HelpText:
Using this field delay from End of Valid video data from Source to Power-Off can be specified in 100uS.
Valid Range: 0 to 500 msec
Using this field Power-off time can be specified in 100uS.

Block.PageName: eDP Fast Link Training Configuration Parameters

PageID.HelpText: This feature allows for the selection of the Fast Link Training feature is to be enabled or disabled.

This field specifies Data Rate to be used for Fast Link Training in unit of 200KHz for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.

In case of EDP Fast Link Training Params(FLT), if user enters FLT Link Rate value greater than the "eDP Max Port Link Rate"  then driver would use 
   Fast Link training Link Rate = MIN (FLT Link Rate ,  eDP Max Port Link Rate).
This feature allows for the selection of the Lane Count (Port Width) for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
This feature allows for the selection of the Pre-emphasis value for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
This feature allows for the selection of the Voltage Swing value for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
When panel is in PSR mode and 'Full Link Enable' is set to Yes, Link is kept in standby state.
When panel is exiting PSR mode and 'Require AUX to wake up' is set to Yes, the AUX channel handshake(link training is required) will be used.

PageID.WidgetName: Lines to wait before link standby:
PageID.HelpText:
This field determines Lines to wait before link standby
0 lines to wait (Default)
1 lines to wait
4 lines to wait
8 lines to wait
Others Reserved

Idle frames to wait for PSR enable.
Allowed values 0-15. Default value is 0.
This field selects the link training TP1(Training Pattern1) time during PSR exit(wake up)

PageID.WidgetName: Channel Equalization Time for PSR1 panel:
PageID.HelpText: This field selects the link training TP2(Training Pattern2) or TP3(Training Pattern3) or TP4(Training Pattern4) time during PSR1 exit(wake up)

PageID.WidgetName: Channel Equalization Time for PSR2 panel:
PageID.HelpText: This field selects the link training TP2(Training Pattern2) or TP3(Training Pattern3) or TP4(Training Pattern4) time during PSR2 exit(wake up)
This field enables/disables the Apical Assertive Display IP for this panel.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific Panel OUI field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD base address field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD Irdidix control 0 field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD option select field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific backlight value.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific Ambient light value.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific backlight scale field.

PageID.WidgetName: IntelÂ® Display Power Saving Technology (DPST) (Mobile only):
PageID.HelpText:
This feature determines whether the IntelÂ® Display Power Savings Technology (DPST) is enabled or disabled.
IntelÂ® DPST is a display power savings technology that changes the intensity of colors in order to conserve backlight power.
Note: This technology is only active when the system is running in battery mode and the LFP is the only active display device.
This feature determines whether Panel Self Refresh (PSR) feature is to be enabled.

PageID.WidgetName: IntelÂ® Display Refresh Rate Switching (DRRS) (Mobile only):
PageID.HelpText: This feature determines whether IntelÂ® Display Refresh Rate Switching (DRRS) is to be enabled.
This feature, when enabled, will set Display Lace Support otherwise, the  functionality will be disabled.
This feature determines whether Assertive display technology is to be enabled.

PageID.WidgetName: Dynamic Media Refresh Rate Switching Enable/Disable
PageID.HelpText: This feature determines whether Dynamic media refresh rate switching is to be enabled.

This feature determines whether IntelÂ® Automatic Display Brightness is to be enabled. IntelÂ® Automatic Display Brightness adjusts the brightness of the embedded Local Flat Panel (LFP) depending on the current ambient light environment.
When enabled, the driver and VBIOS will control the backlight brightness of the LFP depending on the ambient environment if and only if the LFP is the only active display. When disabled, the driver will perform no action.

This feature  will allow users to disable/enable  the edp 4k/2k HOBL(Hours Of Battery Life) feature by programming relevant registers specific for a platform.
.
This feature, when enabled, will set Default Display LACE Enabled status otherwise, the  functionality will be disabled.

This feature allows for the selection of DPST Aggressiveness level for this Panel Type.
1 (Maximum Quality with No DPST)
2
3
4
5
6 (Maximum Battery)

This feature allows for the selection of LACE Aggressiveness level for this Panel Type.
Minimum   0
Moderate  1
High      2
VRR (Variable Refresh Rate) is a feature that can continuously and seamlessly vary Refresh Rate on the fly, on displays that support Variable Refresh rate Technologies.
Pixel Clock (in KHz) Range from 0.001 to  4294967.295 MP/s.
Horizontal Active Image Pixels Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Active Image Lines Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Blank Pixels Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Blank lines Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Front Porch Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Front Porch Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Sync Width Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Sync Width Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Addressable Video Image Size in mm represented by 16bits. Image size multiplier 1.00 mm precision.
Vertical Addressable Video Image Size in mm represented by 16bits. Image size multiplier 1.00 mm precision.

Common DTD Flags:
Bit 7 : Horizontal Sync Polarity
1 : Positive
0 : Negative
Bit 6 : Vertical Sync polarity
1 : Positive
0 : Negative
Bit 5 - 0: Reserved (Default value 0)

This feature allows the 10 bytes of EDID Vendor/Product ID starting at offset 08h to be used as a PnP ID.

Table Definition:
	Word:  ID Manufacturer Name
	Word:  ID Product Code
	DWord: ID Serial Number
	Byte:  Week of Manufacture
	Byte:  Year of Manufacture

This feature allows for the selection of the Backlight Inverter type that is to be used to control the backlight brightness of the LFP.
When PWM is selected, the driver and VBIOS will control the backlight brightness via the integrated PWM solution for the applicable chipsets.
When None/External is selected, the system BIOS will control the backlight brightness via the external solution.
If panel supports 'Intel HDR AUX Interface', it will always be chosen by default. If not, value in 'PWM Source Selection' will be used.
This field allows to select the PWM Controller to be used for the selected Local Flat Panel.

This feature allows the backlight inverter polarity to be specified.
Normal means 0 value is minimum brightness.
Inverted means 0 value is maximum brightness.

This feature allows defining the absolute minimum backlight brightness. The driver will never decrease the backlight less than this value. The value must be specified using normal polarity semantics. The value should range from 0 to 255 if the brightness precision bit is chosen to be 8, and it should range from 0 to 65535 if the precision bit is chosen to be 16.

This feature is used to set default backlight brightness value of the panel at POST. The value should range from 0 to 255 if the bit precision is chosen to be 8 and it should range from 0 to 65535 if the brightness bit precision is chosent to be 16.

This field represents the range of brightness in terms of bit precision.
 8  = Brightness range of 0 to 255 
 9  = Brightness range of 0 to 511 
 10 = Brightness range of 0 to 1023 
 11 = Brightness range of 0 to 2047 
 12 = Brightness range of 0 to 4095 
 13 = Brightness range of 0 to 8191 
 14 = Brightness range of 0 to 16383 
 15 = Brightness range of 0 to 32767 
 16 = Brightness range of 0 to 65535.

This feature allows for the definition of the frequency needed for PWM Inverter.
Note: The frequency range (entered as a decimal number), for the integrated PWM is 200Hz - 40KHz.

This bit enables Chromaticity feature.
If this bit is enabled, EDID values for chromaticity will be used, else feature is disabled.
Feature will be supported for Panels that support EDID version 1.4 or higher.
Please refer to section 3.7 of EDID Specification 1.4.
This option when enabled along with Chromaticity feature will override EDID values through following VBT data
Lower order bytes (bits 1 and 0) of Red, Green Coordinates represented as Rx1 Rx0 Ry1 Ry0 Gx1 Gx0 Gy1 Gy0
Lower order bytes (bits 1 and 0) of Blue, White Coordinates represented as Bx1 Bx0 By1 By0 Wx1 Wx0 Wy1 Wy0
Bits 9:2 of red color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of red color y coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Green color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Green color y coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Blue color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Blue color y coordinate
Bits 9:2 of White color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of White color y coordinate
This option when enabled along with Chromaticity feature will override luminance values following VBT values

Minimum luminance value.
2 byte value, encoded in IEEE 754 half-precision binary floating point format,

Maximum Full frame luminance value.
2 byte value, encoded in IEEE 754 half-precision binary floating point format,

Maximum luminance value(Relatively smaller portion of screen).
2 byte value, encoded in IEEE 754 half-precision binary floating point format.
This option when enabled along with Chromaticity feature will override gamma values through following VBT data

Value shall define the gamma range, from 1.00 to 3.54, as follows:
Field Value = (Gamma (value in float) x 100) - 100
Field values range from 00h through FFh.
FFh = No gamma information shall be provided
VESA DSC Major revision field.
VESA DSC Minor revision field.
Sink supports block prediction as per the VESA DSC Spec.

This feature will allow users to disable/enable Spread Spectrum Clock for eDP.
Select the number of Pixels to be overlapped per half of Scanline while using Edp Multi-SST(MSO) feature.

This feature enables or disables T3 optimization.
When enabled, VBIOS/GOP driver will poll for AUX soon after VDD enable until AUX passes or T3 time is reached
When disabled, VBIOS/GOP driver will wait for T3 time before trying the first AUX transaction

Using this field the delay from LCDVCC to HPD high can be specified in 100uS.
Valid Range: 0 to 200msec

PageID.WidgetName: Valid video data to Backlight Enable delay (T8):
PageID.HelpText:
Using this field the delay from Start of Valid video data from Source to Backlight Enable can be specified in 100uS.
T8 is inclusive of T7.
Valid Range of T7: 0 to 50msec

Using this field the delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable can be specified in 100uS.
Delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable is included in delay from Valid video data to Backlight Enable (T8).
So it is expected that delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable is less than the delay from Valid video data to Backlight Enable (T8).

Using this field delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off can be specified in 100uS.
Delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off is included in delay from Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data (T9).
So it is expected that delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off delay is less than the delay from Backlight Disable to to End of Valid video data (T9).

PageID.WidgetName: Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data delay (T9):
PageID.HelpText: Using this field the delay from Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data can be specified in 100uS.

PageID.WidgetName: End of Valid video data to Power-Off delay (T10):
PageID.HelpText:
Using this field delay from End of Valid video data from Source to Power-Off can be specified in 100uS.
Valid Range: 0 to 500 msec
Using this field Power-off time can be specified in 100uS.

Block.PageName: eDP Fast Link Training Configuration Parameters

PageID.HelpText: This feature allows for the selection of the Fast Link Training feature is to be enabled or disabled.

This field specifies Data Rate to be used for Fast Link Training in unit of 200KHz for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.

In case of EDP Fast Link Training Params(FLT), if user enters FLT Link Rate value greater than the "eDP Max Port Link Rate"  then driver would use 
   Fast Link training Link Rate = MIN (FLT Link Rate ,  eDP Max Port Link Rate).
This feature allows for the selection of the Lane Count (Port Width) for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
This feature allows for the selection of the Pre-emphasis value for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
This feature allows for the selection of the Voltage Swing value for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
When panel is in PSR mode and 'Full Link Enable' is set to Yes, Link is kept in standby state.
When panel is exiting PSR mode and 'Require AUX to wake up' is set to Yes, the AUX channel handshake(link training is required) will be used.

PageID.WidgetName: Lines to wait before link standby:
PageID.HelpText:
This field determines Lines to wait before link standby
0 lines to wait (Default)
1 lines to wait
4 lines to wait
8 lines to wait
Others Reserved

Idle frames to wait for PSR enable.
Allowed values 0-15. Default value is 0.
This field selects the link training TP1(Training Pattern1) time during PSR exit(wake up)

PageID.WidgetName: Channel Equalization Time for PSR1 panel:
PageID.HelpText: This field selects the link training TP2(Training Pattern2) or TP3(Training Pattern3) or TP4(Training Pattern4) time during PSR1 exit(wake up)

PageID.WidgetName: Channel Equalization Time for PSR2 panel:
PageID.HelpText: This field selects the link training TP2(Training Pattern2) or TP3(Training Pattern3) or TP4(Training Pattern4) time during PSR2 exit(wake up)
This field enables/disables the Apical Assertive Display IP for this panel.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific Panel OUI field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD base address field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD Irdidix control 0 field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD option select field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific backlight value.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific Ambient light value.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific backlight scale field.

PageID.WidgetName: IntelÂ® Display Power Saving Technology (DPST) (Mobile only):
PageID.HelpText:
This feature determines whether the IntelÂ® Display Power Savings Technology (DPST) is enabled or disabled.
IntelÂ® DPST is a display power savings technology that changes the intensity of colors in order to conserve backlight power.
Note: This technology is only active when the system is running in battery mode and the LFP is the only active display device.
This feature determines whether Panel Self Refresh (PSR) feature is to be enabled.

PageID.WidgetName: IntelÂ® Display Refresh Rate Switching (DRRS) (Mobile only):
PageID.HelpText: This feature determines whether IntelÂ® Display Refresh Rate Switching (DRRS) is to be enabled.
This feature, when enabled, will set Display Lace Support otherwise, the  functionality will be disabled.
This feature determines whether Assertive display technology is to be enabled.

PageID.WidgetName: Dynamic Media Refresh Rate Switching Enable/Disable
PageID.HelpText: This feature determines whether Dynamic media refresh rate switching is to be enabled.

This feature determines whether IntelÂ® Automatic Display Brightness is to be enabled. IntelÂ® Automatic Display Brightness adjusts the brightness of the embedded Local Flat Panel (LFP) depending on the current ambient light environment.
When enabled, the driver and VBIOS will control the backlight brightness of the LFP depending on the ambient environment if and only if the LFP is the only active display. When disabled, the driver will perform no action.

This feature  will allow users to disable/enable  the edp 4k/2k HOBL(Hours Of Battery Life) feature by programming relevant registers specific for a platform.
.
This feature, when enabled, will set Default Display LACE Enabled status otherwise, the  functionality will be disabled.

This feature allows for the selection of DPST Aggressiveness level for this Panel Type.
1 (Maximum Quality with No DPST)
2
3
4
5
6 (Maximum Battery)

This feature allows for the selection of LACE Aggressiveness level for this Panel Type.
Minimum   0
Moderate  1
High      2
VRR (Variable Refresh Rate) is a feature that can continuously and seamlessly vary Refresh Rate on the fly, on displays that support Variable Refresh rate Technologies.
Pixel Clock (in KHz) Range from 0.001 to  4294967.295 MP/s.
Horizontal Active Image Pixels Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Active Image Lines Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Blank Pixels Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Blank lines Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Front Porch Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Front Porch Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Sync Width Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Sync Width Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Addressable Video Image Size in mm represented by 16bits. Image size multiplier 1.00 mm precision.
Vertical Addressable Video Image Size in mm represented by 16bits. Image size multiplier 1.00 mm precision.

Common DTD Flags:
Bit 7 : Horizontal Sync Polarity
1 : Positive
0 : Negative
Bit 6 : Vertical Sync polarity
1 : Positive
0 : Negative
Bit 5 - 0: Reserved (Default value 0)

This feature allows the 10 bytes of EDID Vendor/Product ID starting at offset 08h to be used as a PnP ID.

Table Definition:
	Word:  ID Manufacturer Name
	Word:  ID Product Code
	DWord: ID Serial Number
	Byte:  Week of Manufacture
	Byte:  Year of Manufacture

This feature allows for the selection of the Backlight Inverter type that is to be used to control the backlight brightness of the LFP.
When PWM is selected, the driver and VBIOS will control the backlight brightness via the integrated PWM solution for the applicable chipsets.
When None/External is selected, the system BIOS will control the backlight brightness via the external solution.
If panel supports 'Intel HDR AUX Interface', it will always be chosen by default. If not, value in 'PWM Source Selection' will be used.
This field allows to select the PWM Controller to be used for the selected Local Flat Panel.

This feature allows the backlight inverter polarity to be specified.
Normal means 0 value is minimum brightness.
Inverted means 0 value is maximum brightness.

This feature allows defining the absolute minimum backlight brightness. The driver will never decrease the backlight less than this value. The value must be specified using normal polarity semantics. The value should range from 0 to 255 if the brightness precision bit is chosen to be 8, and it should range from 0 to 65535 if the precision bit is chosen to be 16.

This feature is used to set default backlight brightness value of the panel at POST. The value should range from 0 to 255 if the bit precision is chosen to be 8 and it should range from 0 to 65535 if the brightness bit precision is chosent to be 16.

This field represents the range of brightness in terms of bit precision.
 8  = Brightness range of 0 to 255 
 9  = Brightness range of 0 to 511 
 10 = Brightness range of 0 to 1023 
 11 = Brightness range of 0 to 2047 
 12 = Brightness range of 0 to 4095 
 13 = Brightness range of 0 to 8191 
 14 = Brightness range of 0 to 16383 
 15 = Brightness range of 0 to 32767 
 16 = Brightness range of 0 to 65535.

This feature allows for the definition of the frequency needed for PWM Inverter.
Note: The frequency range (entered as a decimal number), for the integrated PWM is 200Hz - 40KHz.

This bit enables Chromaticity feature.
If this bit is enabled, EDID values for chromaticity will be used, else feature is disabled.
Feature will be supported for Panels that support EDID version 1.4 or higher.
Please refer to section 3.7 of EDID Specification 1.4.
This option when enabled along with Chromaticity feature will override EDID values through following VBT data
Lower order bytes (bits 1 and 0) of Red, Green Coordinates represented as Rx1 Rx0 Ry1 Ry0 Gx1 Gx0 Gy1 Gy0
Lower order bytes (bits 1 and 0) of Blue, White Coordinates represented as Bx1 Bx0 By1 By0 Wx1 Wx0 Wy1 Wy0
Bits 9:2 of red color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of red color y coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Green color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Green color y coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Blue color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Blue color y coordinate
Bits 9:2 of White color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of White color y coordinate
This option when enabled along with Chromaticity feature will override luminance values following VBT values

Minimum luminance value.
2 byte value, encoded in IEEE 754 half-precision binary floating point format,

Maximum Full frame luminance value.
2 byte value, encoded in IEEE 754 half-precision binary floating point format,

Maximum luminance value(Relatively smaller portion of screen).
2 byte value, encoded in IEEE 754 half-precision binary floating point format.
This option when enabled along with Chromaticity feature will override gamma values through following VBT data

Value shall define the gamma range, from 1.00 to 3.54, as follows:
Field Value = (Gamma (value in float) x 100) - 100
Field values range from 00h through FFh.
FFh = No gamma information shall be provided
VESA DSC Major revision field.
VESA DSC Minor revision field.
Sink supports block prediction as per the VESA DSC Spec.

PageID.WidgetName: RC Buffer Block size as per VESA DSC Spec:
PageID.HelpText: RC buffer block size for a single RC buffer as defined by the VESA DSC spec.

PageID.WidgetName: Number of RC buffer blocks as per VESA DSC Spec:
PageID.HelpText:
This field defines the number of RC buffers as per VESA DSC spec.
The number of RC buffers used by the software shall be (Value + 1) where Value is in range 0 to 127.

PageID.WidgetName: Slices per line supported by the sink device:
PageID.HelpText:
This field defines the slices per line supported by the sink device.
The field is defined in bitmap fashion and details of each bits are as defined below:
	Bits 31-10		 Bit 9	Bit 8	Bit 7	Bit 6	Bit 5	Bit 4	 Bit 3	 Bit 2	 Bit 1	 Bit 0
	Reserved		 24	 20	 16	 12	 10	 8	 6	 4	 2	 1
Bit = 0, not supported. Bit = 1, supported
Note: Assumption is that sink shall support all lower slices per line than maximum selected field. i.e. If it supports say 8 slices per line, it will also support 4/2/1 slices per line

PageID.WidgetName: Line buffer depth as per VESA DSC Spec:
PageID.HelpText: Line buffer depth in bits as per VESA DSC spec.

PageID.WidgetName: Input compression BPC supported by the sink device:
PageID.HelpText:
This field defines the compression input bpc supported by the sink device.
The field is defined in bitmap fashion and details of each bits are as defined below:
	Bits 7-4	  Bit 3	  Bit 2	  Bit 1	  Bit 0
	Rsvd	   12 bpc	 10bpc	  8bpc	   Rsvd
Bit = 0, not supported. Bit = 1, supported
Note: Assumption is that sink shall support all lower bpc values than the maximum selected field. i.e. If it supports say 12bpc, it will also support 10 and 8bpc as well

As of today, we are supporting 6/8/10/12 BPP for compression output.
Select the most appropriate BPP as supported by the sink.

PageID.WidgetName: Slice height supported by the sink device:
PageID.HelpText:
Slice height supported by the sink device for DSC slice.
Note: Slice height must divide the picture height uniformly.
This feature defines the LFP panel name, used by driver only. Panel name can be only of 13 characters maximum and rest of the characters will be truncated.
This value specifies the Target X-Resolution for this panel.
This value specifies the Target Y-Resolution for this panel.

Using this field the minimum Refresh Rate to be used for Seamless DRRS feature can be entered in Hertz.
Note: Graphics driver will use this field only when EDID support is disabled in VBT configuration.
This feature allows OEM to select the Backlight Technology.
This feature specifies the Panel Rotation of LFP panel used.
This feature specifies the Panel Position of LFP panel used.

This feature  will allow users to disable/enable Dual LFP Port Sync and it is applicable for DDI-A, DDI-B in case of eDP and DSI-0, DSI-1 in case of MIPI. 
.

This feature determines whether Panel Self Refresh (PSR) feature is to be enabled.

PageID.WidgetName: IntelÂ® Display Refresh Rate Switching (DRRS) (Mobile only):
PageID.HelpText: This feature determines whether IntelÂ® Display Refresh Rate Switching (DRRS) is to be enabled.
This feature, when enabled, will set Display Lace Support otherwise, the  functionality will be disabled.
This feature determines whether Assertive display technology is to be enabled.

PageID.WidgetName: Dynamic Media Refresh Rate Switching Enable/Disable
PageID.HelpText: This feature determines whether Dynamic media refresh rate switching is to be enabled.

This feature determines whether IntelÂ® Automatic Display Brightness is to be enabled. IntelÂ® Automatic Display Brightness adjusts the brightness of the embedded Local Flat Panel (LFP) depending on the current ambient light environment.
When enabled, the driver and VBIOS will control the backlight brightness of the LFP depending on the ambient environment if and only if the LFP is the only active display. When disabled, the driver will perform no action.

This feature  will allow users to disable/enable  the edp 4k/2k HOBL(Hours Of Battery Life) feature by programming relevant registers specific for a platform.
.
This feature, when enabled, will set Default Display LACE Enabled status otherwise, the  functionality will be disabled.

This feature allows for the selection of DPST Aggressiveness level for this Panel Type.
1 (Maximum Quality with No DPST)
2
3
4
5
6 (Maximum Battery)

This feature allows for the selection of LACE Aggressiveness level for this Panel Type.
Minimum   0
Moderate  1
High      2
VRR (Variable Refresh Rate) is a feature that can continuously and seamlessly vary Refresh Rate on the fly, on displays that support Variable Refresh rate Technologies.
Pixel Clock (in KHz) Range from 0.001 to  4294967.295 MP/s.
Horizontal Active Image Pixels Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Active Image Lines Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Blank Pixels Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Blank lines Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Front Porch Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Front Porch Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Sync Width Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Sync Width Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Addressable Video Image Size in mm represented by 16bits. Image size multiplier 1.00 mm precision.
Vertical Addressable Video Image Size in mm represented by 16bits. Image size multiplier 1.00 mm precision.

Common DTD Flags:
Bit 7 : Horizontal Sync Polarity
1 : Positive
0 : Negative
Bit 6 : Vertical Sync polarity
1 : Positive
0 : Negative
Bit 5 - 0: Reserved (Default value 0)

This feature allows the 10 bytes of EDID Vendor/Product ID starting at offset 08h to be used as a PnP ID.

Table Definition:
	Word:  ID Manufacturer Name
	Word:  ID Product Code
	DWord: ID Serial Number
	Byte:  Week of Manufacture
	Byte:  Year of Manufacture

This feature allows for the selection of the Backlight Inverter type that is to be used to control the backlight brightness of the LFP.
When PWM is selected, the driver and VBIOS will control the backlight brightness via the integrated PWM solution for the applicable chipsets.
When None/External is selected, the system BIOS will control the backlight brightness via the external solution.
If panel supports 'Intel HDR AUX Interface', it will always be chosen by default. If not, value in 'PWM Source Selection' will be used.
This field allows to select the PWM Controller to be used for the selected Local Flat Panel.

This feature allows the backlight inverter polarity to be specified.
Normal means 0 value is minimum brightness.
Inverted means 0 value is maximum brightness.

This feature allows defining the absolute minimum backlight brightness. The driver will never decrease the backlight less than this value. The value must be specified using normal polarity semantics. The value should range from 0 to 255 if the brightness precision bit is chosen to be 8, and it should range from 0 to 65535 if the precision bit is chosen to be 16.

This feature is used to set default backlight brightness value of the panel at POST. The value should range from 0 to 255 if the bit precision is chosen to be 8 and it should range from 0 to 65535 if the brightness bit precision is chosent to be 16.

This field represents the range of brightness in terms of bit precision.
 8  = Brightness range of 0 to 255 
 9  = Brightness range of 0 to 511 
 10 = Brightness range of 0 to 1023 
 11 = Brightness range of 0 to 2047 
 12 = Brightness range of 0 to 4095 
 13 = Brightness range of 0 to 8191 
 14 = Brightness range of 0 to 16383 
 15 = Brightness range of 0 to 32767 
 16 = Brightness range of 0 to 65535.

This feature allows for the definition of the frequency needed for PWM Inverter.
Note: The frequency range (entered as a decimal number), for the integrated PWM is 200Hz - 40KHz.

This bit enables Chromaticity feature.
If this bit is enabled, EDID values for chromaticity will be used, else feature is disabled.
Feature will be supported for Panels that support EDID version 1.4 or higher.
Please refer to section 3.7 of EDID Specification 1.4.
This option when enabled along with Chromaticity feature will override EDID values through following VBT data
Lower order bytes (bits 1 and 0) of Red, Green Coordinates represented as Rx1 Rx0 Ry1 Ry0 Gx1 Gx0 Gy1 Gy0
Lower order bytes (bits 1 and 0) of Blue, White Coordinates represented as Bx1 Bx0 By1 By0 Wx1 Wx0 Wy1 Wy0
Bits 9:2 of red color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of red color y coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Green color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Green color y coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Blue color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Blue color y coordinate
Bits 9:2 of White color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of White color y coordinate
This option when enabled along with Chromaticity feature will override luminance values following VBT values

Minimum luminance value.
2 byte value, encoded in IEEE 754 half-precision binary floating point format,

Maximum Full frame luminance value.
2 byte value, encoded in IEEE 754 half-precision binary floating point format,

Maximum luminance value(Relatively smaller portion of screen).
2 byte value, encoded in IEEE 754 half-precision binary floating point format.
This option when enabled along with Chromaticity feature will override gamma values through following VBT data

Value shall define the gamma range, from 1.00 to 3.54, as follows:
Field Value = (Gamma (value in float) x 100) - 100
Field values range from 00h through FFh.
FFh = No gamma information shall be provided
VESA DSC Major revision field.
VESA DSC Minor revision field.
Sink supports block prediction as per the VESA DSC Spec.

PageID.WidgetName: RC Buffer Block size as per VESA DSC Spec:
PageID.HelpText: RC buffer block size for a single RC buffer as defined by the VESA DSC spec.

PageID.WidgetName: Number of RC buffer blocks as per VESA DSC Spec:
PageID.HelpText:
This field defines the number of RC buffers as per VESA DSC spec.
The number of RC buffers used by the software shall be (Value + 1) where Value is in range 0 to 127.

PageID.WidgetName: Slices per line supported by the sink device:
PageID.HelpText:
This field defines the slices per line supported by the sink device.
The field is defined in bitmap fashion and details of each bits are as defined below:
	Bits 31-10		 Bit 9	Bit 8	Bit 7	Bit 6	Bit 5	Bit 4	 Bit 3	 Bit 2	 Bit 1	 Bit 0
	Reserved		 24	 20	 16	 12	 10	 8	 6	 4	 2	 1
Bit = 0, not supported. Bit = 1, supported
Note: Assumption is that sink shall support all lower slices per line than maximum selected field. i.e. If it supports say 8 slices per line, it will also support 4/2/1 slices per line

PageID.WidgetName: Line buffer depth as per VESA DSC Spec:
PageID.HelpText: Line buffer depth in bits as per VESA DSC spec.

PageID.WidgetName: Input compression BPC supported by the sink device:
PageID.HelpText:
This field defines the compression input bpc supported by the sink device.
The field is defined in bitmap fashion and details of each bits are as defined below:
	Bits 7-4	  Bit 3	  Bit 2	  Bit 1	  Bit 0
	Rsvd	   12 bpc	 10bpc	  8bpc	   Rsvd
Bit = 0, not supported. Bit = 1, supported
Note: Assumption is that sink shall support all lower bpc values than the maximum selected field. i.e. If it supports say 12bpc, it will also support 10 and 8bpc as well

As of today, we are supporting 6/8/10/12 BPP for compression output.
Select the most appropriate BPP as supported by the sink.

PageID.WidgetName: Slice height supported by the sink device:
PageID.HelpText:
Slice height supported by the sink device for DSC slice.
Note: Slice height must divide the picture height uniformly.
This feature defines the LFP panel name, used by driver only. Panel name can be only of 13 characters maximum and rest of the characters will be truncated.
This value specifies the Target X-Resolution for this panel.
This value specifies the Target Y-Resolution for this panel.

Using this field the minimum Refresh Rate to be used for Seamless DRRS feature can be entered in Hertz.
Note: Graphics driver will use this field only when EDID support is disabled in VBT configuration.
This feature allows OEM to select the Backlight Technology.
This feature specifies the Panel Rotation of LFP panel used.
This feature specifies the Panel Position of LFP panel used.

This feature  will allow users to disable/enable Dual LFP Port Sync and it is applicable for DDI-A, DDI-B in case of eDP and DSI-0, DSI-1 in case of MIPI. 
.

PageID.WidgetName: eDP Fast Link Training Configuration Parameters
Edp Max Port Link Rate (in 200 Khz):
PageID.Visibility: Block:2, Field:LFP_Device_Class, Value:6150 or Block:2, Field:LFP2_Device_Class, Value:6150
PageID.HelpText:
This field specifies EDP Max Port Link Rate supported by the port in unit of 200KHz.
Default value would be "0", in which case Display Drivers should consider EDP Max Port Link Rate to be the Platform supported Max Link Rate.
Only when OEM's need to limit to particular Link Rate can enter the value as mentioned in below table.

Note:
1) OEM's need to enter the values mentioned from below table only.
2) If value entered is not matching with any of the below values then Platform supported Max Link Rate should be considere as EDP Max Port Link Rate by the display drivers.
3) In case of EDP Fast Link Training Params(FLT), if user enters FLT Link Rate value greater than the "eDP Max Port Link Rate"  then we need to use 
   Fast Link training Link Rate = MIN (FLT Link Rate ,  eDP Max Port Link Rate)
---------------------------------------------------------
|	Link Rate(Gbps)	|	 Value to enter in text field	|
|	 		|	 in terms of 200KHZ    	|
---------------------------------------------------------
|	 1.62 		|	        8100           	|
|	 2.16 		|	        10800          	|
|	 2.43 		|	        12150          	|
|	 2.7  		|	        13500          	|
|	 3.24 		|	        16200          	|
|	 3.78 		|	        18900          	|
|	 4.32 		|	        21600          	|
|	 5.4  		|	        27000          	|
|	 6.48 		|	        32400          	|
|	 6.75 		|	        33750          	|
|	 8.1  		|	        40500          	|
This feature specifies the color depth of eDP panel used.

(mV) 		 Level-2/300mV 		 300mV, 0.0db 		 300mV, 1.3db 		 N/A 		  N/A
		 Level-3/350mV 		 350mV, 0.0db 		 N/A 		  N/A 		  N/A


For HBR3:
						 Pre-Emphasis (db)
		 DP Applet 		 Level-0/0dB 		 Level-1/1.5dB 		 Level-2/4dB 		 Level-3/6dB
Voltage 		 Level-0/350mV 		 350mV, 0.0db 		 350mV, 3.1db 		 350mV, 6.0db 		 350mV, 8.2db
Swing 		 Level-1/500mV 		 500mV, 0.0db 		 500mV, 2.9db 		 500mV, 5.1db 		 N/A
(mV) 		 Level-2/650mV 		 650mV, 0.6db 		 600mV, 3.5db 		 N/A 		  N/A
		 Level-3/900mV 		 900mV, 0.0db 		 N/A 		  N/A 		  N/A


Default VSwing Pre-Emphasis Setting Table:
For HBR:
						 Pre-Emphasis (db)
		 DP Applet 		 Level-0/0dB 		 Level-1/1.5dB 		 Level-2/4dB 		 Level-3/6dB
Voltage 		 Level-0/350mV 		 350mV, 0.0db 		 350mV, 3.1db 		 350mV, 6.0db 		 350mV, 8.2db
Swing 		 Level-1/500mV 		 500mV, 0.0db 		 500mV, 2.9db 		 500mV, 5.1db 		 N/A
(mV) 		 Level-2/650mV 		 650mV, 0.6db 		 600mV, 3.5db 		 N/A 		  N/A
		 Level-3/900mV 		 900mV, 0.0db 		 N/A 		  N/A 		  N/A


For HBR2:
						 Pre-Emphasis (db)
		 DP Applet 		 Level-0/0dB 		 Level-1/1.5dB 		 Level-2/4dB 		 Level-3/6dB
Voltage 		 Level-0/350mV 		 350mV, 0.0db 		 350mV, 3.1db 		 350mV, 6.0db 		 350mV, 8.2db
Swing 		 Level-1/500mV 		 500mV, 0.0db 		 500mV, 2.9db 		 500mV, 5.1db 		 N/A

This feature will allow users to disable/enable Spread Spectrum Clock for eDP.
Select the number of Pixels to be overlapped per half of Scanline while using Edp Multi-SST(MSO) feature.

This feature enables or disables T3 optimization.
When enabled, VBIOS/GOP driver will poll for AUX soon after VDD enable until AUX passes or T3 time is reached
When disabled, VBIOS/GOP driver will wait for T3 time before trying the first AUX transaction

Using this field the delay from LCDVCC to HPD high can be specified in 100uS.
Valid Range: 0 to 200msec

PageID.WidgetName: Valid video data to Backlight Enable delay (T8):
PageID.HelpText:
Using this field the delay from Start of Valid video data from Source to Backlight Enable can be specified in 100uS.
T8 is inclusive of T7.
Valid Range of T7: 0 to 50msec

Using this field the delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable can be specified in 100uS.
Delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable is included in delay from Valid video data to Backlight Enable (T8).
So it is expected that delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable is less than the delay from Valid video data to Backlight Enable (T8).

Using this field delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off can be specified in 100uS.
Delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off is included in delay from Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data (T9).
So it is expected that delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off delay is less than the delay from Backlight Disable to to End of Valid video data (T9).

PageID.WidgetName: Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data delay (T9):
PageID.HelpText: Using this field the delay from Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data can be specified in 100uS.

PageID.WidgetName: End of Valid video data to Power-Off delay (T10):
PageID.HelpText:
Using this field delay from End of Valid video data from Source to Power-Off can be specified in 100uS.
Valid Range: 0 to 500 msec
Using this field Power-off time can be specified in 100uS.

Block.PageName: eDP Fast Link Training Configuration Parameters

PageID.HelpText: This feature allows for the selection of the Fast Link Training feature is to be enabled or disabled.

This field specifies Data Rate to be used for Fast Link Training in unit of 200KHz for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.

In case of EDP Fast Link Training Params(FLT), if user enters FLT Link Rate value greater than the "eDP Max Port Link Rate"  then driver would use 
   Fast Link training Link Rate = MIN (FLT Link Rate ,  eDP Max Port Link Rate).
This feature allows for the selection of the Lane Count (Port Width) for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
This feature allows for the selection of the Pre-emphasis value for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
This feature allows for the selection of the Voltage Swing value for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
When panel is in PSR mode and 'Full Link Enable' is set to Yes, Link is kept in standby state.
When panel is exiting PSR mode and 'Require AUX to wake up' is set to Yes, the AUX channel handshake(link training is required) will be used.

PageID.WidgetName: Lines to wait before link standby:
PageID.HelpText:
This field determines Lines to wait before link standby
0 lines to wait (Default)
1 lines to wait
4 lines to wait
8 lines to wait
Others Reserved

Idle frames to wait for PSR enable.
Allowed values 0-15. Default value is 0.
This field selects the link training TP1(Training Pattern1) time during PSR exit(wake up)

PageID.WidgetName: Channel Equalization Time for PSR1 panel:
PageID.HelpText: This field selects the link training TP2(Training Pattern2) or TP3(Training Pattern3) or TP4(Training Pattern4) time during PSR1 exit(wake up)

PageID.WidgetName: Channel Equalization Time for PSR2 panel:
PageID.HelpText: This field selects the link training TP2(Training Pattern2) or TP3(Training Pattern3) or TP4(Training Pattern4) time during PSR2 exit(wake up)
This field enables/disables the Apical Assertive Display IP for this panel.

This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD base address field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD Irdidix control 0 field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD option select field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific backlight value.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific Ambient light value.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific backlight scale field.

PageID.HelpText:
This field specifies EDP Max Port Link Rate supported by the port in unit of 200KHz.
Default value would be "0", in which case Display Drivers should consider EDP Max Port Link Rate to be the Platform supported Max Link Rate.
Only when OEM's need to limit to particular Link Rate can enter the value as mentioned in below table.

Note:
1) OEM's need to enter the values mentioned from below table only.
2) If value entered is not matching with any of the below values then Platform supported Max Link Rate should be considere as EDP Max Port Link Rate by the display drivers.
3) In case of EDP Fast Link Training Params(FLT), if user enters FLT Link Rate value greater than the "eDP Max Port Link Rate"  then we need to use 
   Fast Link training Link Rate = MIN (FLT Link Rate ,  eDP Max Port Link Rate)
---------------------------------------------------------
|	Link Rate(Gbps)	|	 Value to enter in text field	|
|	 		|	 in terms of 200KHZ    	|
---------------------------------------------------------
|	 1.62 		|	        8100           	|
|	 2.16 		|	        10800          	|
|	 2.43 		|	        12150          	|
|	 2.7  		|	        13500          	|
|	 3.24 		|	        16200          	|
|	 3.78 		|	        18900          	|
|	 4.32 		|	        21600          	|
|	 5.4  		|	        27000          	|
|	 6.48 		|	        32400          	|
|	 6.75 		|	        33750          	|
|	 8.1  		|	        40500          	|
This feature specifies the color depth of eDP panel used.

This feature will allow users to disable/enable Spread Spectrum Clock for eDP.
Select the number of Pixels to be overlapped per half of Scanline while using Edp Multi-SST(MSO) feature.

This feature enables or disables T3 optimization.
When enabled, VBIOS/GOP driver will poll for AUX soon after VDD enable until AUX passes or T3 time is reached
When disabled, VBIOS/GOP driver will wait for T3 time before trying the first AUX transaction

Using this field the delay from LCDVCC to HPD high can be specified in 100uS.
Valid Range: 0 to 200msec

PageID.WidgetName: Valid video data to Backlight Enable delay (T8):
PageID.HelpText:
Using this field the delay from Start of Valid video data from Source to Backlight Enable can be specified in 100uS.
T8 is inclusive of T7.
Valid Range of T7: 0 to 50msec

Using this field the delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable can be specified in 100uS.
Delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable is included in delay from Valid video data to Backlight Enable (T8).
So it is expected that delay from PWM-On to Backlight Enable is less than the delay from Valid video data to Backlight Enable (T8).

Using this field delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off can be specified in 100uS.
Delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off is included in delay from Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data (T9).
So it is expected that delay from Backlight Disable to PWM-Off delay is less than the delay from Backlight Disable to to End of Valid video data (T9).

PageID.WidgetName: Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data delay (T9):
PageID.HelpText: Using this field the delay from Backlight Disable to End of Valid video data can be specified in 100uS.

PageID.WidgetName: End of Valid video data to Power-Off delay (T10):
PageID.HelpText:
Using this field delay from End of Valid video data from Source to Power-Off can be specified in 100uS.
Valid Range: 0 to 500 msec
Using this field Power-off time can be specified in 100uS.

Block.PageName: eDP Fast Link Training Configuration Parameters

PageID.HelpText: This feature allows for the selection of the Fast Link Training feature is to be enabled or disabled.

This field specifies Data Rate to be used for Fast Link Training in unit of 200KHz for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.

In case of EDP Fast Link Training Params(FLT), if user enters FLT Link Rate value greater than the "eDP Max Port Link Rate"  then driver would use 
   Fast Link training Link Rate = MIN (FLT Link Rate ,  eDP Max Port Link Rate).
This feature allows for the selection of the Lane Count (Port Width) for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
This feature allows for the selection of the Pre-emphasis value for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
This feature allows for the selection of the Voltage Swing value for the embedded DP link. It will be used if the sink indicates that no aux handshake is required during link training.
When panel is in PSR mode and 'Full Link Enable' is set to Yes, Link is kept in standby state.
When panel is exiting PSR mode and 'Require AUX to wake up' is set to Yes, the AUX channel handshake(link training is required) will be used.

PageID.WidgetName: Lines to wait before link standby:
PageID.HelpText:
This field determines Lines to wait before link standby
0 lines to wait (Default)
1 lines to wait
4 lines to wait
8 lines to wait
Others Reserved

Idle frames to wait for PSR enable.
Allowed values 0-15. Default value is 0.
This field selects the link training TP1(Training Pattern1) time during PSR exit(wake up)

PageID.WidgetName: Channel Equalization Time for PSR1 panel:
PageID.HelpText: This field selects the link training TP2(Training Pattern2) or TP3(Training Pattern3) or TP4(Training Pattern4) time during PSR1 exit(wake up)

PageID.WidgetName: Channel Equalization Time for PSR2 panel:
PageID.HelpText: This field selects the link training TP2(Training Pattern2) or TP3(Training Pattern3) or TP4(Training Pattern4) time during PSR2 exit(wake up)
This field enables/disables the Apical Assertive Display IP for this panel.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific Panel OUI field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD base address field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD Irdidix control 0 field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific DPCD option select field.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific backlight value.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific Ambient light value.
This field specifies the Apical IP specific backlight scale field.

PageID.WidgetName: IntelÂ® Display Power Saving Technology (DPST) (Mobile only):
PageID.HelpText:
This feature determines whether the IntelÂ® Display Power Savings Technology (DPST) is enabled or disabled.
IntelÂ® DPST is a display power savings technology that changes the intensity of colors in order to conserve backlight power.
Note: This technology is only active when the system is running in battery mode and the LFP is the only active display device.
This feature determines whether Panel Self Refresh (PSR) feature is to be enabled.

PageID.WidgetName: IntelÂ® Display Refresh Rate Switching (DRRS) (Mobile only):
PageID.HelpText: This feature determines whether IntelÂ® Display Refresh Rate Switching (DRRS) is to be enabled.
This feature, when enabled, will set Display Lace Support otherwise, the  functionality will be disabled.
This feature determines whether Assertive display technology is to be enabled.

PageID.WidgetName: Dynamic Media Refresh Rate Switching Enable/Disable
PageID.HelpText: This feature determines whether Dynamic media refresh rate switching is to be enabled.

This feature determines whether IntelÂ® Automatic Display Brightness is to be enabled. IntelÂ® Automatic Display Brightness adjusts the brightness of the embedded Local Flat Panel (LFP) depending on the current ambient light environment.
When enabled, the driver and VBIOS will control the backlight brightness of the LFP depending on the ambient environment if and only if the LFP is the only active display. When disabled, the driver will perform no action.

This feature  will allow users to disable/enable  the edp 4k/2k HOBL(Hours Of Battery Life) feature by programming relevant registers specific for a platform.
.
This feature, when enabled, will set Default Display LACE Enabled status otherwise, the  functionality will be disabled.

This feature allows for the selection of DPST Aggressiveness level for this Panel Type.
1 (Maximum Quality with No DPST)
2
3
4
5
6 (Maximum Battery)

This feature allows for the selection of LACE Aggressiveness level for this Panel Type.
Minimum   0
Moderate  1
High      2
VRR (Variable Refresh Rate) is a feature that can continuously and seamlessly vary Refresh Rate on the fly, on displays that support Variable Refresh rate Technologies.
Pixel Clock (in KHz) Range from 0.001 to  4294967.295 MP/s.
Horizontal Active Image Pixels Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Active Image Lines Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Blank Pixels Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Blank lines Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Front Porch Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Front Porch Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Sync Width Number of Pixels ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Vertical Sync Width Number of lines ranges from 1 to 65,536.
Horizontal Addressable Video Image Size in mm represented by 16bits. Image size multiplier 1.00 mm precision.
Vertical Addressable Video Image Size in mm represented by 16bits. Image size multiplier 1.00 mm precision.

Common DTD Flags:
Bit 7 : Horizontal Sync Polarity
1 : Positive
0 : Negative
Bit 6 : Vertical Sync polarity
1 : Positive
0 : Negative
Bit 5 - 0: Reserved (Default value 0)

This feature allows the 10 bytes of EDID Vendor/Product ID starting at offset 08h to be used as a PnP ID.

Table Definition:
	Word:  ID Manufacturer Name
	Word:  ID Product Code
	DWord: ID Serial Number
	Byte:  Week of Manufacture
	Byte:  Year of Manufacture

This feature allows for the selection of the Backlight Inverter type that is to be used to control the backlight brightness of the LFP.
When PWM is selected, the driver and VBIOS will control the backlight brightness via the integrated PWM solution for the applicable chipsets.
When None/External is selected, the system BIOS will control the backlight brightness via the external solution.
If panel supports 'Intel HDR AUX Interface', it will always be chosen by default. If not, value in 'PWM Source Selection' will be used.
This field allows to select the PWM Controller to be used for the selected Local Flat Panel.

This feature allows the backlight inverter polarity to be specified.
Normal means 0 value is minimum brightness.
Inverted means 0 value is maximum brightness.

This feature allows defining the absolute minimum backlight brightness. The driver will never decrease the backlight less than this value. The value must be specified using normal polarity semantics. The value should range from 0 to 255 if the brightness precision bit is chosen to be 8, and it should range from 0 to 65535 if the precision bit is chosen to be 16.

This feature is used to set default backlight brightness value of the panel at POST. The value should range from 0 to 255 if the bit precision is chosen to be 8 and it should range from 0 to 65535 if the brightness bit precision is chosent to be 16.

This field represents the range of brightness in terms of bit precision.
 8  = Brightness range of 0 to 255 
 9  = Brightness range of 0 to 511 
 10 = Brightness range of 0 to 1023 
 11 = Brightness range of 0 to 2047 
 12 = Brightness range of 0 to 4095 
 13 = Brightness range of 0 to 8191 
 14 = Brightness range of 0 to 16383 
 15 = Brightness range of 0 to 32767 
 16 = Brightness range of 0 to 65535.

This feature allows for the definition of the frequency needed for PWM Inverter.
Note: The frequency range (entered as a decimal number), for the integrated PWM is 200Hz - 40KHz.

This bit enables Chromaticity feature.
If this bit is enabled, EDID values for chromaticity will be used, else feature is disabled.
Feature will be supported for Panels that support EDID version 1.4 or higher.
Please refer to section 3.7 of EDID Specification 1.4.
This option when enabled along with Chromaticity feature will override EDID values through following VBT data
Lower order bytes (bits 1 and 0) of Red, Green Coordinates represented as Rx1 Rx0 Ry1 Ry0 Gx1 Gx0 Gy1 Gy0
Lower order bytes (bits 1 and 0) of Blue, White Coordinates represented as Bx1 Bx0 By1 By0 Wx1 Wx0 Wy1 Wy0
Bits 9:2 of red color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of red color y coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Green color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Green color y coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Blue color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of Blue color y coordinate
Bits 9:2 of White color x coordinate
Bits 9:2 of White color y coordinate
This option when enabled along with Chromaticity feature will override luminance values following VBT values

Minimum luminance value.
2 byte value, encoded in IEEE 754 half-precision binary floating point format,

Maximum Full frame luminance value.
2 byte value, encoded in IEEE 754 half-precision binary floating point format,

Maximum luminance value(Relatively smaller portion of screen).
2 byte value, encoded in IEEE 754 half-precision binary floating point format.
This option when enabled along with Chromaticity feature will override gamma values through following VBT data

Value shall define the gamma range, from 1.00 to 3.54, as follows:
Field Value = (Gamma (value in float) x 100) - 100
Field values range from 00h through FFh.
FFh = No gamma information shall be provided
VESA DSC Major revision field.
VESA DSC Minor revision field.
Sink supports block prediction as per the VESA DSC Spec.

PageID.WidgetName: RC Buffer Block size as per VESA DSC Spec:
PageID.HelpText: RC buffer block size for a single RC buffer as defined by the VESA DSC spec.

PageID.WidgetName: Number of RC buffer blocks as per VESA DSC Spec:
PageID.HelpText:
This field defines the number of RC buffers as per VESA DSC spec.
The number of RC buffers used by the software shall be (Value + 1) where Value is in range 0 to 127.

PageID.WidgetName: Slices per line supported by the sink device:
PageID.HelpText:
This field defines the slices per line supported by the sink device.
The field is defined in bitmap fashion and details of each bits are as defined below:
	Bits 31-10		 Bit 9	Bit 8	Bit 7	Bit 6	Bit 5	Bit 4	 Bit 3	 Bit 2	 Bit 1	 Bit 0
	Reserved		 24	 20	 16	 12	 10	 8	 6	 4	 2	 1
Bit = 0, not supported. Bit = 1, supported
Note: Assumption is that sink shall support all lower slices per line than maximum selected field. i.e. If it supports say 8 slices per line, it will also support 4/2/1 slices per line

PageID.WidgetName: Line buffer depth as per VESA DSC Spec:
PageID.HelpText: Line buffer depth in bits as per VESA DSC spec.

PageID.WidgetName: Input compression BPC supported by the sink device:
PageID.HelpText:
This field defines the compression input bpc supported by the sink device.
The field is defined in bitmap fashion and details of each bits are as defined below:
	Bits 7-4	  Bit 3	  Bit 2	  Bit 1	  Bit 0
	Rsvd	   12 bpc	 10bpc	  8bpc	   Rsvd
Bit = 0, not supported. Bit = 1, supported
Note: Assumption is that sink shall support all lower bpc values than the maximum selected field. i.e. If it supports say 12bpc, it will also support 10 and 8bpc as well

As of today, we are supporting 6/8/10/12 BPP for compression output.
Select the most appropriate BPP as supported by the sink.

PageID.WidgetName: Slice height supported by the sink device:
PageID.HelpText:
Slice height supported by the sink device for DSC slice.
Note: Slice height must divide the picture height uniformly.
This feature defines the LFP panel name, used by driver only. Panel name can be only of 13 characters maximum and rest of the characters will be truncated.
This value specifies the Target X-Resolution for this panel.
This value specifies the Target Y-Resolution for this panel.

Using this field the minimum Refresh Rate to be used for Seamless DRRS feature can be entered in Hertz.
Note: Graphics driver will use this field only when EDID support is disabled in VBT configuration.
This feature allows OEM to select the Backlight Technology.
This feature specifies the Panel Rotation of LFP panel used.
This feature specifies the Panel Position of LFP panel used.

This feature  will allow users to disable/enable Dual LFP Port Sync and it is applicable for DDI-A, DDI-B in case of eDP and DSI-0, DSI-1 in case of MIPI. 
.
